data.title: Very Good for Waco
data.text: This is a nice dinner house with a warm atmosphere.  Food was very good but I would skip the Seafood Curry - too soupy.  But ordering fish in Waco might not be the best choice.  Service was very good, helpful and friendly.  We had a large group and were taken care of well.  They have some unusual items on the menu such as the octopus appetizer which was very good.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review but just wanted to let you and others know that we specialize in bringing Waco the freshest seafood possible! Our fresh seafood is flown in to Dallas and then brought to us here in Waco.  It arrives twice a week on ice.  Then Chef Aris does his magic by filleting the big fish like Halibut and Sea Bass.  So ordering from our market fresh seafood menu, we guarantee its freshness!  And for the Seafood Curry, that is one of our popular items and the only Curry dish that you can get in Waco.  There are so many options here at 1424 and I would ask you to go to www.1424bistro.com and see the entire menu.  We offer something great for everyone.  Thanks again for your positive review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Average
data.text: After reading the reviews we were excited to try the bistro.  Our service was average with the waitress coming back on 2 occasions to recheck what we had ordered.  Bread service was bland with hard butter in individual plastic containers, the Caesar salads were good but dinner was disappointing, chicken alfredo was very soupy and appetizer was lukewarm.    The ambiance was very pleasant but it was very over priced for average food and lackluster service.

data.title: great food great coctails
data.text: great fresh fish in a familly place and the most delicious Pasta Alfredo i ate there!!!!!special coktails in the garden

data.title: Date Night
data.text: My wife and I ordered a bottle of wine and an shrimp and scallops as an appetizer. Both were excellent. Our waiter, Dalton, was most attentive. I ordered beef tenderloin and the wife ordered mahi mahi. The food was amazing!! To cap the night off, we ordered creme brûlée and coffee. Most excellent atmosphere and food.

data.title: Expensive
data.text: Food was just ok. Ceasar salad is not served with croutons but with crushed crumbs.  Thought that was strange. The ceasar dressing was good.  Chicken picata was just ok. Service was excellent.

data.title: Fixer Upper Trip
data.text: Best meal in whole Texas trip. Despite not finding the door at first we had a great meal and excellent service at this restaurant. Liz pointed it out on our tour and it is well worth your time to have dinner there

data.title: Tasty Dinner
data.text: This lovely little place was a nice spot for a very tasty dinner. Delicious fish options, and a willingness to substitute carbs for veggies without fuss or upcharge. Nice staff.

data.title: Outstanding Restaurant
data.text: Come and enjoy the casual elegance of one of Waco's better restaurants. The menu is excellent. I recommend the Orange Roughy or their Jambalaya from scratch; however my wife loves the Beef Wellington. The Chocolate Brulee' is also a special treat to close out your meal. I highly recommend 1424 for any special night or if visiting the Waco area.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We greatly appreciate your review and so happy to serve you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Place in Waco
data.text:
My wife and I go to 1424 whenever we can. It's by far the best place for a date in Waco. The lamb shanks are to die for and not expensive! For lunch, the lamb gyros are amazing and the lunch options are super affordable. 

I went to NYC recently and had high expectations but honestly, I couldn't find any Greek/Mediterranean food that was better. It made me realize how spoiled I am. by 1424. If I could eat here every week, I would.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your business and review!  Thanks so much!  The only change that we made recently is having closed the weekday lunches.  But you can still get the lunch menu on Sunday.  Hours are:  Dinner: Tues.-Sat. 5pm to 10pm, Sun. 11am to 2pm and 5pm-9pm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food, nice patio
data.text: The food here is consistently good.  They do a good job with both beef and seafood.  They always have several specials that usually quite good, but check the price before ordering. They on a list with no prices and are usually a good bit more expensive than the rest of the menu.  To me the interior has a strange smell, but you don't notice it after the first couple of minutes.  Because of that I always sit outdoors, weather permitting.  The patio area is a great place to enjoy a nice meal when it's not 40 or 100 degrees.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We thank you as our customer and reviewer and will always work towards solving any problems that arise and we are always trying to make things right.  The front dining and bar area is from the original back in the fifties ( as a popular Candy Shop).  We have replaced a cracked ventilation pipe for plumbing which we suspected was the problem.    We are a privately owned restaurant and family operated.  We are there many hours in the day and care deeply about what we serve and what our customers want.  We have brought to Waco fresh seafood.  The fresh seafood menu card doesn't have prices due to changes in prices from our fresh seafood supplier. On the card, it is noted to ask your server for pricing. It is fresh and not frozen seafood which is brought fresh from Dallas on ice.  We pride ourselves in offering fresh seafood to Waco flown in from the coasts--east, west and gulf and even some seafood from overseas like our Chilean Sea Bass.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dark with an odd smell
data.text: We had a graduation lunch at this restaurant. My first impression was not great from the drive up / outside but I did like the seating in the courtyard. When I went inside, it felt really dark and I sensed a strange odor...not one of candles or great food but more like human waste unfortunately. It was warm in temperature as well which did not help. All in all, the restaurant could be cool and cozy but instead, it is dated and dank and did not seem very clean. With the said, I was not too excited about eating there. Nothing got any better after that. The menu has too much variety....is it an Italian restaurant or a seafood restaurant? Who knows. They really need " restaurant to the rescue" to come in and save them. Overall, I would not go back. Bad smell, dreary decor and atmosphere. But, the place has great potential and is in a good location.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are sorry that you were not happy with our restaurant.  We do try our best to create a pleasant and desirable ambiance. About 5 years ago, we expanded our restaurant by adding a new addition through the tunnel.  However, original building has a lot of history and is old. It housed a very popular Candy Shop and later on a church long ago in the fifties.  This front area where you enter is remodeled too with an added bar and arches to give it a European look.  We are sorry about the smell you encountered.  It was not noticed until after Baylor graduation.  There was a small crack in a ventilation pipe from the closed front restroom area.  It has now been fixed.  Sorry, that this ruined your dining experience.  About the cleanliness, we scored perfect without any demerits from the city health department.  Our cuisine is European with emphasis on seafood.  We are pleased to serve Waco fresh seafood and all our dishes are made in house with lots of fresh vegetables, fruits, butter and olive oil.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Took my husband here for his birthday...what a fabulous meal.  We sat outside on a beautiful evening while enjoying some of the best food I've eaten in Waco.  Our server was prompt and attentive, with a good sense of humor.  We will definitely be back again.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your nice review.  We do our best to serve you and look forward to serving you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Girl's night
data.text: Had a great time dining here last night while in Waco. Read reviews on TA. The food was really good and lots of it. I had the salmon with vegetables and my friend had the shrimp scampi. The wine list was extensive. The only negative was slow service but there was a very large group there at the same time. We will be back next time we're in town.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We greatly appreciate your nice review and glad your enjoyed your meal.  We are sorry about the slow service due to a large group before you.  Thanks again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice atmosphere but disappointing food
data.text:
We wanted a nicer spot for dinner that wasn't outrageously overpriced, so we tried 1424 Bistro.  It's a little hard to find, even more difficult to find the door because the place looked closed to us.  But the restaurant has a lot of charm because of the exposed brick, dark woodwork, nice linens, and soft lighting.  We were glad the place was not full because all the hard surfaces amplified the noise so much if was difficult to have a conversation.

We had a nice waiter who was familiar with the menu and made drink recommendations.  I got a Cosmopolitan martini that tasted like cough syrup (won't order that again).  We had Cesar salads that looked ok, nothing to write home about; but the dressing had so much pepper we couldn't finish them.  My friend had the scallops which she enjoyed.  I had their take on Beef Wellington.  The puff pastry got mushy quickly and the beef was not the tenderest.  The overall effect was a fancy pot pie.  The fresh side vegetables were well done.

The price for the meal was reasonable.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am truly sorry about your disappointing experience with the food and cocktail.  We do try to always make everything fresh and tasting great so we will have customers to return.  We try to control our alcoholic drinks by measuring. If you say that it tasted like cough syrup, I am so sorry.  I hope that you returned it and told the wait staff about it.  We use top shelf liquor--Absolut Citron, orange liquer (which if the bartender put in too much, it would taste too sweet), cranberry juice and fresh squeezed lime.  I will also let the Chef know about the entree and vegetables.  It is a popular dish and I am sorry it was not enjoyed. I wish we had another chance to make it right.  We will address your comments.  Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Over priced!
data.text: My wife and I dined there last night and to be frank I was most disappointed. We got there on a Saturday night between 8:45 and 9:00 and we were promptly seated as there were very few other people there. I ordered a Sautéed Shrimp appetizer, and we got 7 nice sized peeled and deveined shrimp. The problem was they were so over cooked that they were tough as rubber.  We both ordered the fresh Red Snapper which were then informed they were out of, so she got the Swordfish and I got the Halibut. Each dinner came with 2 selected sides and choice of salad. None on these menu selections were priced and they only stated as per the "market"  The portions were small but that's ok, I was not that hungry anyway and I prefer quality to quantity. First the salads arrived, my wife had ordered the Caesar and I ordered the house tossed with house dressing. Both salads served us were Caesar and I elected not to say anything and change my thinking to a good Caesar.  I may have done just that but the this salad was generic in quality with little or no taste.  Then the main course were served and promptly may I add.  The fish was cooked correctly and the sides were good but not outstanding.  And now for the final service of the night, the check. Mind you we each had a cocktail and she had house red and I had a beer with the main meal. We had no desert.  After tip the Credit Card got hammered for over $165.00 WOW.  I guess that might be why there was no one else in the place??

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Manager at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We apologize for the shrimp appetizer not coming out to your expectations.  We do our best to cook seafood appropriately and would have cooked another for you, if you had told the server. Our Fresh Seafood Menu is the small extra menu we add to the regular menu.  Yes, it doesn't have the price-since the prices do change.  But on average the fresh seafood entree is priced around $28 to $44. It does come with a salad and two sides.  It does mention on the menu to ask your server for pricing.  I did a bit of research on fresh seafood at a few restaurants but they are not in the Waco area.  Salads and sides are usually extra. Swordfish was priced at $44. Our seafood like Salmon, Sea Bass, Halibut, Snapper, Tuna and Swordfish  are flown in fresh to DFW and delivered quickly to our restaurant on ice by truck.  I am truly sorry for the server not informing you on the price and will let our servers know to better inform our customers of the price.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great ambience and dining in Central Texas
data.text: A friend and I wanted to treat ourselves to a nice dining experience while spending the day in Waco.  We arrived early (5 p.m. - opening time on Saturdays)  and were greeted by a friendly staff.  Tables quickly filled so obviously this is a popular spot.  We both chose the Sea Bass that was served with two vegetables and a salad.  It was delicious.  Our server, Chris, was fantastic and very attentive  ....I also recommend the Cosmopolitan Martinis!  Will definitely return.

owner_response.author: BluecatWaco, Owner at 1424 Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your review.  It is important that our satisfied customers take the time to write a review.  We appreciate you time and look forward to serving you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text: Overall the food was just ok. The atmosphere was great and just what we wanted for a nicer date night. Good service and not overly crowded.

data.title: Excellent Beef Wellington
data.text: Pretty ambiance and interior.  The outside and area of the restaurant was a bit old and run down.  Location was really away from downtown.  I almost didn't think there was a restaurant.

data.title: Parent's weekend
data.text: Excellent! Ambiance, food, service. All great. Sea bass and chicken piccata fantastic. Chris gave great service. Crime brûlée and bread pudding great!

data.title: Not Impressed
data.text: We started with the Saganiki flambe cheese which is a slice of Greek cheese between two rinds. The rind made the cheese tough especially when it cooled and the cheese tasted salty. My wife had Portobello Mushroom which was too cheesy for her taste. Our friend had Fettucine Alfredo which was tasteless and she hardly touched it. I had the 1424 Beef Wellinton with rice and roasted peppers. It was all very bland. We ended with a Vanilla Creme Brule which was good but small.
